law.catch_line: In a civil case in which a jury trial is allowed, the jury shall consist of six jurors....

text.section: In a civil case in which a jury trial is allowed, the jury shall consist of six jurors.
If the parties in a civil case agree, a trial judge may dispense with selecting an array of at least 14 qualified jurors.
If the parties in a criminal case agree, a trial judge may dispense with selecting an array of at least 20 qualified jurors.
